metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6835 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The reset1 function in libaudiofile/modules/BlockCodec.cpp in Audio File Library (aka audiofile) 0.3.6 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero error and crash) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

audiofile-tools - 0.3.6-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libaudiofile1 - 0.3.6-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> same fix as for CVE-2017-6832, CVE-2017-6833, CVE-2017-6835

criterions.comment: audiofile package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.6-2ubuntu0.16.04.1').
